channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: My Word for 2024: Strong
item.description: Before I begin, know that I fully recognize that it’s May. I selected my word of the year way back in December of 2023. After letting it marinade for a few days, I spent an hour looking for the perfect bracelet on Etsy that would display its letters each and every day. I also knew... Read More

item.title: Try This To Get Your Digestive System Running Like Clockwork*
item.description: It's easier than you may think.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Comprehensive Cancer Center to highlight key studies at ASCO 2024
item.description: ROCHESTER, Minn. — Researchers from the Mayo Clinic Comprehensive Cancer Center are set to present key research findings, including two late-breaking abstracts, during the 2024 American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Annual Meeting in Chicago May 31-June 4. These studies shed light on critical aspects of cancer treatment and management. Below are the highlights: The […] The post Mayo Clinic Comprehensive Cancer Center to highlight key studies at ASCO 2024 appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: The Sound of Freedom
item.description: For a million years (more like 15,) I’ve been listening to a radio show: The Taylor Strecker Show. It’s a daily show that originated on SiriusXM and through a series of events became an independently broadcasted show on Patreon. There’s something interesting that happens when you listen to a daily show. You get to know... Read More

item.title: Want To Pick Up A New Habit? Do This To Increase The Odds Of Success
item.description: It's always helpful to dig deeper and figure out why you want change.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Benefits of an active workstation
item.description: For the millions of people who sit at a desk for long hours at a time, day after day, you may want to stand up for this. Mayo Clinic research shows that using an active workstation can help you move more and think better at work — without affecting your job. Sitting too much at work or home […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Benefits of an active workstation appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part Two]
item.description: To review part one of this adventure with Taylor Swift, click here. Click here to see all the Instagram highlight videos from Denver Night One. Mile High Stadium was pink and sparkly from head to toe. Never had I ever seen so many women in one place, nor so many generations piled into one venue. ... Read More

item.description: Sky-high volume, here we come!

item.title: A Mayo Clinic virologist explains FLiRT and why you may need a new COVID-19 vaccination
item.description: A new variant of COVID-19, known as FLiRT, is now the most dominant strain in the U.S. This variant, which evolved from the omicron strain, is characterized by changes in its spike protein — the part of the virus that binds to host cells. Dr. Matthew Binnicker, director of the Clinical Virology Laboratory at Mayo Clinic, says that […] The post A Mayo Clinic virologist explains FLiRT and why you may need a new COVID-19 vaccination appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part One]
item.description: Do you ever have one of those experiences where you want to remember exactly how you felt? That’s how I feel about my experience at the Taylor Swift concert this weekend. Correction: At the Eras Tour. Saying it was a concert does not feel like enough to justify the magnitude of the event. Let’s talk about the... Read More

item.description: Calling all perfumeheads.

item.title: New research platform assesses brain cancer mutations during surgery
item.description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. — Brain cancer is difficult to treat when it starts growing, and a prevalent type, known as a glioma, has a poor five-year survival rate. In a new study published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, Mayo Clinic researchers report on a new surgical platform used during surgery that informs critical […] The post New research platform assesses brain cancer mutations during surgery appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.

item.title: Jenny Craig Recipe Creation: Turkey Philly Baguette
item.description: Special thanks to Jenny Craig for their sponsorship of this post. In honor of the Super Bowl this year, I decided to make a Philly to enjoy. Knowing the Philadelphia Eagles were playing (and with no plans to watch the game), I let the City of Brotherly Love inspire this tasty dish. I used the Jenny Craig... Read More

item.description: Underrated and oh-so-simple.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: No ‘lesser evil’ when it comes to tobacco use
item.description: Editors note: May 31 is World No Tobacco Day From the traditional cigarette to the modern electronic cigarette, from the communal hookah to the discreet pinch of smokeless tobacco, each has proven to be detrimental to a person's health. In this Mayo Clinic Minute, Dr. Jon Ebbert, medical director of the Mayo Clinic Nicotine Dependence Center, discusses […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: No ‘lesser evil’ when it comes to tobacco use appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .
